intro: Centaurea leucophaea subsp. ochrolopha, commonly known as the yellow centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense, branched clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine. The subspecies ochrolopha is distinguished by its more intense yellow coloration compared to other subspecies of Centaurea leucophaea.
